greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Harmonic residue of n.
comment: The harmonic residue is the remainder when n*d(n) is divided by sigma(n), where d(n) is the number of divisors of n and sigma(n) is the sum of the divisors of n. If n is perfect, the harmonic residue of n is 0.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A038040(n) - A000203(n) * A240471(n) . - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 06 2014
program: a106315 n = n * a000005 n `mod` a000203 n -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 06 2014
xref: Cf. A106316, A106317, A001599 (positions of zeros).
results.author: George J. Schaeffer (gschaeff(AT)andrew.cmu.edu), Apr 29 2005
